channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Senate heads home with no deal to speed confirmations as irate Trump tells Schumer to 'go to hell'
item.description: Without a deal in hand, Republicans say they may try to change Senate rules when they return in September to speed up the pace of confirmations.

item.title: "48 Hours" show schedule
item.description: True crime. Real justice. To miss it would be a crime.

item.title: Earthquake in Bergen County shakes parts of New Jersey, New York
item.description: An earthquake in Hasbrouck Heights, Bergen County, shook parts of New Jersey and New York on Saturday night.

item.title: Watch: Australians play in snowy winter wonderland
item.description: Parts of New South Wales were blanketed with the heaviest snow in 20 years.

item.title: Watch: Explosion rocks Russian oil facility
item.description: The strike was one of several Ukraine said it carried out against Russian military infrastructure.

item.title: The Yogurt Shop Murders
item.description: The murders of four teenage girls have haunted Austin, Texas, for more than 30 years. Could new information lead to a killer? "48 Hours" correspondent...

item.title: 'I felt an unspoken pressure to smile' - Kenyan women in the workplace
item.description: Is the pressure to be likeable holding women back at work?

item.title: Tens of thousands turn out for Sydney Pro-Palestine march
item.description: The Sydney Harbour Bridge was closed by the march, after it was authorised to go ahead by the Supreme Court hours earlier.

item.title: At this summer camp run by grandmas, kids learn cooking skills and life advice

item.description: Trump explains why he fired Bureau of Labor Statistics Commissioner, outlines new tariff rates; Rare Grateful Dead photographs come to life 60 years a...

item.title: Son of Sam: The Killer Speaks
item.description: Nearly five decades ago, the "Son of Sam" terrorized New York City. In a 2017 prison interview, convicted serial killer David Berkowitz tells CBS News...

item.title: Ukraine drone attack sparks fire at Sochi oil depot, Russian authorities say
item.description: Meanwhile, Ukraine says Russian missiles hit Mykolaiv.

item.title: 'From the Clinics to the Capitol' links anti-abortion movement to far-right extremism
item.description: NPR's Sarah McCammon speaks with Carol Mason about her new book, From the Clinics to the Capitol: How Opposing Abortion Became Insurrectionary.

item.title: Do conservatives have a role in challenging Trump's foreign policy?

item.title: What's it like to cover your own network when it is in the headlines?
item.description: NPR's David Folkenflik shares what it's been like covering President Trump's contentious relationship with the media, including public media and NPR i...

item.title: Lebanon mourns beloved artist Ziad Rahbani
item.description: Lebanon has lost one of its most beloved artists, the playwright and musician Ziad Rahbani.
